name: Sammy Kaye
description: '''Sammy Kaye''' (born '''Samuel Zarnocay Jr.'''; March 13, 1910 – June 2, 1987) was an American bandleader and songwriter, whose tag line, "Swing and Sway with Sammy Kaye", became one of the most famous of the [[Big Band]] Era. The expression springs from his first hit single in 1937, "[[Sammy Kaye discography#Singles|Swing and Sway]]" (U.S. no. 15). He was the first to record and release the standard "[[Blueberry Hill]]" in 1940. During World War II, he co-wrote and recorded the anthemic "[[Remember Pearl Harbor (song)|Remember Pearl Harbor]]" (U.S. No. 3). He was the first to record and release the no. 1 song "[[Daddy (Sammy Kaye song)|Daddy]]" in 1941. His final number one hit was "[[Harbor Lights (song)|Harbor Lights]] in 1950.
